channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2782] 'South Park' airs 'censored' episode after threat
item.description: LOS ANGELES, April 21 (Reuters) - Satirical animated TV show "South Park" beeped out the words Prophet Muhammad and plastered its Wednesday episode with the word "CENSORED" after being issued a grim warning by a U.S. Muslim group.

item.title: [+2501] This Has Got To Be The Most Depressing Game I've Ever Played
[+2084] Guy is Completely Wasted, Needs Flip-Flop [Vid]
item.description: You can do it man, just reach for the sky!You've either been there before, and feel for him; or don't remember being there before and are probably him. *hic*

item.title: [+1913] Fox Fires Back at Jon Stewart. Jon Replies Musically...
item.description: Bernie Goldberg criticizes Jon for not being fair and balanced, a slogan he never follows. Jon in turn apologizes for criticizing Bernie Goldberg and Fox News, but it's only because they're a terrible, cynical, disingenuous news organization.

item.title: [+1831] How to Name a Volcano - The Oatmeal
item.description: Making my new book has taken a little longer than expected, but it's almost finished. In the meantime, here's a quickie comic about volcanoes.

item.title: [+1530] Linux on the iPhone: Android running on iPhone!
[+1441] Fascinating and even a little frightening and creepy
item.description: Fascinating and even a little frightening and creepy. I Can't. Stop!

item.title: [+1272] New Left Media challenges Tea Party to explain themselves.
item.description: A correspondent for New Left Media ventured out among the tea partiers during their tax day protests in Washington D.C. to interview them about what it is that's fueling their fierce opposition to to the government in general and President Obama in particular. Suffice to say, the answers involve lots of wild-eyed claims about tyranny and social

item.title: [+1260] What is legal is not always right
item.description: You will be furious when you finish this column. Fair warning.

item.title: [+1246] Digg, "1000 AwesomeThings" Thanks You!
item.description: A very sincere thank you, from one heck of a nice guy.

item.title: [+1149] Squirrel Fights off Crows - Protects Dead Friend's Body
item.description: One squirrel lies dead in the road but his friend fights off the crows who come to eat him. http://brk.to/breakiphoneyt - link to Break's free iPhone app.

item.title: [+1132] Batman 3 Probably Won't Be In 3D
item.description: Filmmakers have begun using digital cameras that allows actors and actresses on screen to reach out and pickpocket the audience. But not Dark Knight director Christopher Nolan. He thinks it's just a fad.

item.title: [+1052] Wanna See Jar Jar Binks Savagely Elbowed in the Face? (PIC)
item.description: That's what I thought. You're welcome.

item.title: [+857] Pornstar Verifies Her Age, Saves Fan From 20 Years In Prison
item.description: New York native Carlos Simon-Timmerman bought a DVD of adult film star Lupe Fuentes at a flea market while vacationing in Venezuela, only to be stopped in San Juan, Puerto Rico on his way home where he was arrested and charged with illegal possession and transportation of images involving minors.

item.title: [+815] Former Hacker: Microsoft More Secure Than Apple and Adobe
item.description: A seasoned hacker believes Microsoft is now more secure than both Apple and Adobe, claiming Apple has only started taking seriously in the last six months.

item.title: [+797] 1,000 Things You Don't Know About Women
item.description: Fun facts about women, from the ones in our lives. We asked women to share their secrets about life, sex, friendship, and what we've been doing wrong (and right) our whole lives.

item.title: [+732] The iPhone 4G Story May Have Made Gizmodo Richer by $150,000
item.description: Wondering how much money Gizmodo, the gadget website, may have made by publishing pictures of the iPhone 4G phone? Here's a clue.

item.title: [+698] Never take the parking space of a woman!
[+609] Apple Hit Back at Adobe, Flash is 'Closed and Proprietary'
item.description: In a rare public comment, Apple's public relations department responded Wednesday to criticisms from the project manager for Adobe Flash, suggesting his recent criticism of Apple was "backwards." In a statement to CNet's DeepTech, Apple spokeswoman Trudy Miller fired back at Adobe's Mike Chambers, who revealed this week that his company was...

item.title: [+604] Hey Adobe, Dump Apple, Go Linux
item.description: Since Apple has barred Adobe from its lucrative iPad/iPhone business isn't it time for Adobe to make friends with Google and Linux?
